verses.verse: The children <S%H1121><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> again <S%H3254><s%> did <S%H6213><s%> that which was evil <S%H7451><s%> in the sight <S%H5869><s%> of Yahweh, <S%H3068><s%> when Ehud <S%H164><s%> was dead. <S%H4191><s%>

Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> sold <S%H4376><s%> them into the hand <S%H3027><s%> of Jabin <S%H2985><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> of Canaan, <S%H3667><s%> who reigned <S%H4427><s%> in Hazor; <S%H2674><s%> the captain <S%H8269><s%> of whose army <S%H6635><s%> was Sisera, <S%H5516><s%> who lived <S%H3427><s%> in Harosheth <S%H2800><s%> of the Gentiles. <S%H1471><s%>

The children <S%H1121><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> cried <S%H6817><s%> to Yahweh: <S%H3068><s%> for he had nine <S%H8672><s%> hundred <S%H3967><s%> chariots <S%H7393><s%> of iron; <S%H1270><s%> and twenty <S%H6242><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> he mightily <S%H2394><s%> oppressed <S%H3905><s%> the children <S%H1121><s%> of Israel. <S%H3478><s%>
Now Deborah, <S%H1683><s%> a prophetess, <S%H5031><s%> the wife <S%H802><s%> of Lappidoth, <S%H3941><s%> she judged <S%H8199><s%> Israel <S%H3478><s%> at that time. <S%H6256><s%>

She lived <S%H3427><s%> under the palm tree <S%H8560><s%> of Deborah <S%H1683><s%> between Ramah <S%H7414><s%> and Bethel <S%H1008><s%> in the hill <S%H2022><s%> country of Ephraim: <S%H669><s%> and the children <S%H1121><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> came up <S%H5927><s%> to her for judgment. <S%H4941><s%>

She sent <S%H7971><s%> and called <S%H7121><s%> Barak <S%H1301><s%> the son <S%H1121><s%> of Abinoam <S%H42><s%> out of Kedesh Naphtali, <S%H6943><s%> and said <S%H559><s%> to him, <S%H3068><s%> "Hasn't Yahweh, the God <S%H430><s%> of Israel, <S%H3478><s%> commanded, <S%H6680><s%> <S%H3212><s%> 'Go and draw <S%H4900><s%> to Mount <S%H2022><s%> Tabor, <S%H8396><s%> and take <S%H3947><s%> with you ten <S%H6235><s%> thousand <S%H505><s%> men <S%H376><s%> of the children <S%H1121><s%> of Naphtali <S%H5321><s%> and of the children <S%H1121><s%> of Zebulun? <S%H2074><s%>

I will draw <S%H4900><s%> to you, <S%H5158><s%> to the river Kishon, <S%H7028><s%> Sisera, <S%H5516><s%> the captain <S%H8269><s%> of Jabin <S%H2985><s%>'s army, <S%H6635><s%> with his chariots <S%H7393><s%> and his multitude; <S%H1995><s%> and I will deliver <S%H5414><s%> him into your hand. <S%H3027><s%>'"
Barak <S%H1301><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to her, <S%H3212><s%> "If you will go with me, <S%H3212><s%> then I will go; but if you will not go <S%H1980><s%> with me, <S%H3212><s%> I will not go."

She said, <S%H559><s%> "I will surely <S%H1980><s%> go <S%H3212><s%> with you: <S%H657><s%> nevertheless, the journey <S%H1870><s%> that you take <S%H1980><s%> shall not be for your honor; <S%H8597><s%> for Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> will sell <S%H4376><s%> Sisera <S%H5516><s%> into the hand <S%H3027><s%> of a woman. <S%H802><s%>" Deborah <S%H1683><s%> arose, <S%H6965><s%> and went <S%H3212><s%> with Barak <S%H1301><s%> to Kedesh. <S%H6943><s%>

Barak <S%H1301><s%> called <S%H2199><s%> Zebulun <S%H2074><s%> and Naphtali <S%H5321><s%> together to Kedesh; <S%H6943><s%> and there went up <S%H5927><s%> ten <S%H6235><s%> thousand <S%H505><s%> men <S%H376><s%> at his feet: <S%H7272><s%> and Deborah <S%H1683><s%> went up with him. <S%H5927><s%>

Now Heber <S%H2268><s%> the Kenite <S%H7017><s%> had separated <S%H6504><s%> himself from the Kenites, <S%H7017><s%> even from the children <S%H1121><s%> of Hobab <S%H2246><s%> the brother-in <S%H2859><s%>-law of Moses, <S%H4872><s%> and had pitched <S%H5186><s%> his tent <S%H168><s%> as far as the oak <S%H436><s%> in Zaanannim, <S%H6815><s%> which is by Kedesh. <S%H6943><s%>
They told <S%H5046><s%> Sisera <S%H5516><s%> that Barak <S%H1301><s%> the son <S%H1121><s%> of Abinoam <S%H42><s%> was gone up <S%H5927><s%> to Mount <S%H2022><s%> Tabor. <S%H8396><s%>

Sisera <S%H5516><s%> gathered together <S%H2199><s%> all his chariots, <S%H7393><s%> even nine <S%H8672><s%> hundred <S%H3967><s%> chariots <S%H7393><s%> of iron, <S%H1270><s%> and all the people <S%H5971><s%> who were with him, <S%H2800><s%> from Harosheth of the Gentiles, <S%H1471><s%> to the river <S%H5158><s%> Kishon. <S%H7028><s%>

Deborah <S%H1683><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to Barak, <S%H1301><s%> "Go; <S%H6965><s%> for this is the day <S%H3117><s%> in which Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> has delivered <S%H5414><s%> Sisera <S%H5516><s%> into your hand. <S%H3027><s%> Hasn't <S%H3068><s%> Yahweh gone out <S%H3318><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> you? <S%H1301><s%>" So Barak went down <S%H3381><s%> from Mount <S%H2022><s%> Tabor, <S%H8396><s%> and ten <S%H6235><s%> thousand <S%H505><s%> men <S%H376><s%> after him. <S%H310><s%>

Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> confused <S%H2000><s%> Sisera, <S%H5516><s%> and all his chariots, <S%H7393><s%> and all his army, <S%H4264><s%> with the edge <S%H6310><s%> of the sword <S%H2719><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> Barak; <S%H1301><s%> and Sisera <S%H5516><s%> alighted from <S%H3381><s%> his chariot, <S%H4818><s%> and fled away <S%H5127><s%> on his feet. <S%H7272><s%>

But Barak <S%H1301><s%> pursued <S%H7291><s%> after <S%H310><s%> the chariots, <S%H7393><s%> and after the army, <S%H4264><s%> to Harosheth <S%H2800><s%> of the Gentiles: <S%H1471><s%> and all the army <S%H4264><s%> of Sisera <S%H5516><s%> fell <S%H5307><s%> by the edge <S%H6310><s%> of the sword; <S%H2719><s%> there was not a man <S%H259><s%> left. <S%H7604><s%>

However Sisera <S%H5516><s%> fled away <S%H5127><s%> on his feet <S%H7272><s%> to the tent <S%H168><s%> of Jael <S%H3278><s%> the wife <S%H802><s%> of Heber <S%H2268><s%> the Kenite; <S%H7017><s%> for there was peace <S%H7965><s%> between Jabin <S%H2985><s%> the king <S%H4428><s%> of Hazor <S%H2674><s%> and the house <S%H1004><s%> of Heber <S%H2268><s%> the Kenite. <S%H7017><s%>

Jael <S%H3278><s%> went out <S%H3318><s%> to meet <S%H7125><s%> Sisera, <S%H5516><s%> and said <S%H559><s%> to him, <S%H5493><s%> "Turn in, my lord, <S%H113><s%> turn in <S%H5493><s%> to me; <S%H3372><s%> don't be afraid." He came in <S%H5493><s%> to her into the tent, <S%H168><s%> and she covered <S%H3680><s%> him with a rug. <S%H8063><s%>

He said <S%H559><s%> to her, <S%H4592><s%> "Please give me a little water <S%H4325><s%> to drink; <S%H8248><s%> for I am thirsty. <S%H6770><s%>" She opened <S%H6605><s%> a bottle <S%H4997><s%> of milk, <S%H2461><s%> and gave him drink, <S%H8248><s%> and covered him. <S%H3680><s%>

He said <S%H559><s%> to her, <S%H5975><s%> "Stand in the door <S%H6607><s%> of the tent, <S%H168><s%> and it shall be, <S%H376><s%> when any man comes <S%H935><s%> and inquires <S%H7592><s%> of you, <S%H559><s%> and says, <S%H3426><s%> 'Is there any man <S%H376><s%> here? <S%H3426><s%>' that you shall say, <S%H559><s%> 'No.'"

Then Jael <S%H3278><s%> Heber <S%H2268><s%>'s wife <S%H802><s%> took <S%H3947><s%> a tent <S%H168><s%> peg, <S%H3489><s%> and took <S%H7760><s%> a hammer <S%H4718><s%> in her hand, <S%H3027><s%> and went <S%H935><s%> softly <S%H3814><s%> to him, <S%H8628><s%> and struck the peg <S%H3489><s%> into his temples, <S%H7541><s%> and it pierced through into <S%H6795><s%> the ground; <S%H776><s%> for he was in a deep sleep; <S%H7290><s%> so he swooned <S%H5774><s%> and died. <S%H4191><s%>

Behold, <S%H1301><s%> as Barak pursued <S%H7291><s%> Sisera, <S%H5516><s%> Jael <S%H3278><s%> came out <S%H3318><s%> to meet <S%H7125><s%> him, <S%H559><s%> and said to him, <S%H3212><s%> "Come, and I will show <S%H7200><s%> you the man <S%H376><s%> whom you seek. <S%H1245><s%>" He came <S%H935><s%> to her; <S%H5516><s%> and behold, Sisera lay <S%H5307><s%> dead, <S%H4191><s%> and the tent peg <S%H3489><s%> was in his temples. <S%H7541><s%>

So God <S%H430><s%> subdued <S%H3665><s%> on that day <S%H3117><s%> Jabin <S%H2985><s%> the king <S%H4428><s%> of Canaan <S%H3667><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> the children <S%H1121><s%> of Israel. <S%H3478><s%>

The hand <S%H3027><s%> of the children <S%H1121><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> prevailed <S%H7186><s%> more <S%H3212><s%> and more against Jabin <S%H2985><s%> the king <S%H4428><s%> of Canaan, <S%H3667><s%> until they had destroyed <S%H3772><s%> Jabin <S%H2985><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> of Canaan. <S%H3667><s%>
